info.name: Girik Marine API (Role-based)
info.description: Postman collection generated from OpenAPI. Folders: Role (Admin, GM, etc.) → Resource (Certificates, Jobs, etc.) → APIs. Admin has all APIs admin can access; same for other roles.

item.name: 0. Auth & Public
item.description: Login (PUBLIC). After login, copy token to collection variable "token".

request.description:
Authenticate with email and password. Returns user, **accessToken** (short-lived, for API calls), and **refreshToken** (long-lived, for getting new access tokens).
Use **accessToken** in header: `Authorization: Bearer <accessToken>`. Store tokens securely.
Get new **accessToken** and **refreshToken** using a valid refresh token. Send refresh token in body (`refreshToken` or `token`) or in cookie. Response returns both tokens.
Request password reset email.
Reset password using token from email.
Public verification - no auth required
Public vessel verification - no auth required

query.description: Filter by website section (e.g. HOME, PORTFOLIO)

request.description: Retrieve a list of uploaded videos. This endpoint is public and used by the website frontend.
Public verification of certificate by number. No auth required.
Public surveyor application
Anyone visiting the Girik Shipping portfolio website can send a message via this endpoint. No authentication is required.

item.name: ADMIN
item.description: All APIs that role ADMIN can access. Grouped by resource (Certificates, Jobs, etc.). Set token after login.

request.description: Invalidate current session. Clears tokens; response includes accessToken and refreshToken as null.
Returns server health status. No authentication required.

List certificates with strict RBAC and ownership filtering.
**Access:**
- **ADMIN / GM / TM / TO:** All certificates.
- **SURVEYOR:** Only certificates for vessels in jobs assigned to them.
- **CLIENT:** Only certificates for their own company vessels.
Generate a new certificate for a completed job. ADMIN, GM, TM only.

Returns a lightweight list of all active certificate types.
**Does NOT include `required_documents`** — use `GET /types/:id` to fetch
the full detail with required documents for a specific type.

Pass `?include_inactive=true` (ADMIN / GM only) to also see inactive types.

**Roles:** CLIENT, ADMIN, GM, TM, TO, SURVEYOR
Create a new certificate type with optional required documents. ADMIN only.

item.name: Get certificate type detail (with required documents)

request.description:
Returns the **full detail** of a single certificate type, including:
- All metadata fields (`description`, `requires_survey`, etc.)
- The complete list of `required_documents` with their `is_mandatory` flag

This is the endpoint to call **before creating a job** to know which
documents must be uploaded.

**Roles:** CLIENT, ADMIN, GM, TM, TO, SURVEYOR
Update an existing certificate type and its required documents. ADMIN or TM only.
Renew multiple certificates in one operation. ADMIN, TM only.
Get certificates expiring within a date range. ADMIN, GM, TM, TO, CLIENT.
Get all certificates for a specific vessel. Scope restricted (SURVEYOR only assigned, CLIENT only owned).
Get certificate details by ID. Same RBAC as list: ADMIN/GM/TM/TO see all; SURVEYOR only assigned jobs' vessels; CLIENT only own company. Returns 403 if certificate exists but user has no access.

Redirects to the certificate PDF URL for download. If the certificate has a stored PDF (pdf_file_url), returns 302 redirect to that URL so the browser can open or download the file.
CLIENT can only download certificates for their vessels.
Suspend a certificate. ADMIN, TM only.
Revoke a certificate. ADMIN, TM only.
Restore a suspended certificate. ADMIN, TM only.
Renew an expiring certificate. ADMIN, TM only.
Reissue a certificate (e.g. after loss). ADMIN, TM only.
Transfer certificate ownership/association. ADMIN, GM only.
Extend certificate validity. ADMIN, GM only.
Downgrade certificate classification/type. ADMIN, GM only.
Get certificate preview/PDF. ADMIN, GM, TM, TO, SURVEYOR, CLIENT.
Digitally sign a certificate. ADMIN, GM only.
Get signature details for a certificate.
Get certificate change history.

request.description:
Returns a paginated list of job requests. Visible set depends on caller role:
- **CLIENT** – Only jobs for their fleet (vessel_id filtered to client).
- **SURVEYOR** – Only jobs assigned to them (`assigned_surveyor_id = me`).
- **ADMIN / GM / TM / TO / TA / FLAG_ADMIN** – All jobs; defaults to last 30 days
  unless explicit filters are supplied.

Supply `status` as a **comma-separated** string to filter by multiple statuses,
e.g. `?status=ASSIGNED,SURVEY_AUTHORIZED`.

Opens a new certification job request in **CREATED** status.
- **CLIENT** – Can only submit for vessels that belong to their account.
- **ADMIN / GM** – Can submit for any vessel.

If the selected `certificate_type_id` has mandatory required documents
(`CertificateRequiredDocument` where `is_mandatory=true`), each must be
included in `uploaded_documents`; otherwise the request will be rejected
with a `400` listing the missing documents.

Returns full job detail including vessel, certificate type, status history,
uploaded documents, reschedule records, and certificate (with signed URL if
applicable).
- **CLIENT** – Own fleet only.
- **SURVEYOR** – Only if assigned to them.
- **ADMIN / GM / TM / TO** – Any job.

**Transition:** `DOCUMENT_VERIFIED → APPROVED`

General Manager or Admin formally approves the job request after document
verification. Records `approved_by_user_id` on the job.

**Roles:** ADMIN, GM

**Transition:** `APPROVED → FINALIZED`

Only applicable to jobs where `is_survey_required = false`. For jobs that
require a survey, finalization happens automatically when the survey is
completed and the TM finalizes the survey report.

**Roles:** ADMIN, GM, TM

**Transition:** `APPROVED → ASSIGNED`

Assigns a surveyor to the job. The target user must exist and have
`role = SURVEYOR`. Records `assigned_surveyor_id` and `assigned_by_user_id`
and sends a push notification to the surveyor.

**Roles:** ADMIN, GM

**Transition:** `ASSIGNED → SURVEY_AUTHORIZED`

Admin or Technical Manager formally authorizes the survey to proceed.
Requires a surveyor to already be assigned. Notifies the surveyor and the
client. The surveyor can now call `POST /api/v1/surveys/start` to begin.

**Roles:** ADMIN, TM

**Transition:** `SURVEY_DONE` or `REVIEWED → REWORK_REQUESTED`

Sends the job back to the surveyor for corrections.
Notifies the assigned surveyor with the `remarks` reason.

Role-specific from-state constraints:
- **ADMIN** – Any non-terminal state.
- **TM** – `SURVEY_DONE` or `REVIEWED`.
- **TO** – `SURVEY_DONE` only.

**Roles:** ADMIN, TM, TO

Updates `target_date` and/or `target_port` for an existing job.
Allowed when the job is in any of: `CREATED`, `DOCUMENT_VERIFIED`,
`APPROVED`, `ASSIGNED`, `SURVEY_AUTHORIZED`.  
Not allowed after survey starts or in terminal states.

Logs the old and new values in `job_reschedules` and notifies the
assigned surveyor (if any).

**Roles:** ADMIN, GM

**Terminal transition** – moves job to `REJECTED` permanently.

Role-specific constraints:
- **ADMIN** – Any non-terminal job.
- **GM** – Only in `CREATED` state.
- **TM** – Only in `ASSIGNED`, `SURVEY_DONE`, or `REVIEWED` states.

**Roles:** ADMIN, GM, TM

Cancels the job. Maps internally to the `REJECTED` terminal state.

- **CLIENT** – Must own the vessel; cannot cancel once `FINALIZED`,
  `CERTIFIED`, or `REJECTED`.
- **GM / TM / ADMIN** – Any non-terminal job.

**Roles:** CLIENT, GM, TM, ADMIN

Updates the `priority` field of a job. Creates an audit log entry with
the old and new values plus an optional reason.

Priority does **not** affect the job workflow or status — it is a
management flag only, used to sort / filter jobs in dashboards.

| Value | Meaning |
|---|---|
| `LOW` | Non-urgent, can wait |
| `NORMAL` | Standard priority (default) |
| `HIGH` | Requires prompt attention |
| `URGENT` | Must be actioned immediately |

**Roles:** ADMIN, GM, TM
